<<<<<<< HEAD
A declaration from the people called Quakers, to the present distracted nation of England with mourning and lamentation over it, because of its breaches ... Burrough, Edward, 1634-1662.
[2], 14 p.
[s.n.], London : 1659.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library. "The substance of this was given forth ... through E. Burrough ... " signed by fifteen other Friends. Attributed to Edward Burrough. cf. BM.
=======
